Message.Title: Insider trading
Message.Msg: I just took a look at the insider trading section. In the past 6 months, there have been 25 transactions made by the officers of Amazon. These are the people who are in the know about what the shares are worth. The 25 transactions were ALL sales. You won't find anyone who knows what the value of this stock is buying any of it. If I owned some, I would sell it before it crashes.

Message.Msg: The rip your face off is more likely to be the big longs dumping the MOMO scams on traders". They already played the rebalancing scam and it is running out of juice. It should break 100, but that depends upon continued malinvestment from Amazon and a little bit of honesty in the analyst community.

Topic.Title: A decline on steady volume will be followed by a GIGANTIC

Message.Msg: Santos has a pretty good article projecting Q2 earnings, although I think he is overly optimistic (Amazon is getting hammered on the PR front everywhere in Europe now and USD/JPY will have a significant impact on international performance). Once sentiment turns here it will be far too late. AAPL is down almost 50%, despite having $100B in net cash, a healthy dividend and true FCF with high margins. Amazon has levered up into the a looming drop in consumer demand (if things go well...). Watch its net cash position...

Topic.Title: A decline on steady volume will be followed by a GIGANTIC

Message.Msg: Thanks for the referral, and I read the article. Santos has been very close in his predictions lately. He's calling for .07 earnings (in line with estimates) and a miss on revenue. Just like last quarter. Of course, the earnings have been guided down from .22 to .06, so not hard to beat that. My guess is this report hits the stock; maybe 10 points, taking it down to around 250 by the end of July. About where it began the year. Still better than it deserves!

Message.Title: What could take AMZN to $300
Message.Msg: Since nas, bruce, skiidady, nemesis, algebb and all the others have been repeatedly calling for $300 "any day", but are all AWOL these days, I can only wonder what they think will cause that to happen in the short term. Would have to be all of the following: 1. Nice beat on both EPS and Rev for Q2, 2. Fed announces renewed commitment or even ramp-up of QE 3. Some big positive news out of Asia or Europe 4. Strong initial Q2 earnings reports from US companies 5. Consumer confidence grows 6. More jobs added than expected over the next couple months. Did I miss anything? Good luck with this list. You'll need it.

Topic.Title: A decline on steady volume will be followed by a GIGANTIC

Message.Msg: Aside from anchoring and availability biases (tied to "how it is trading"), do you have ANY basis for the $250? My guess is not. It's earning (and cash position) have fallen through the floor since last Fall when it was about the break down through $220. Only CapWorld's CrazyApple (the AppleTrage sabotage) has kept this from tanking... That play has more than run its course...
